trans-unit.source: [optional] Flags that control the ToolTip display:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Flags that control the ToolTip display:

target.mrk: [optional]
Flags that control the ToolTip display:

trans-unit.source: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool

target.mrk: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool

trans-unit.source: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

target.mrk: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

trans-unit.source: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction of the parent window (see remarks)

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction of the parent window (see remarks)

target.mrk: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction of the parent window (see remarks)

trans-unit.source: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window

target.mrk: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window

trans-unit.source: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

target.mrk: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

trans-unit.source: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION. (see remarks)

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION.
(see remarks)

target.mrk: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION.
(see remarks)

trans-unit.source: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

target.mrk: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

trans-unit.source: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

target.mrk: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

trans-unit.source: Default = BitOr($TTF_SUBCLASS, $TTF_IDISHWND)

seg-source.mrk: Default = BitOr($TTF_SUBCLASS, $TTF_IDISHWND)

target.mrk: Default = BitOr($TTF_SUBCLASS, $TTF_IDISHWND)

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: If a notification callback is needed, you have to set $sText = -1 (LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK).

seg-source.mrk: If a notification callback is needed, you have to set $sText = -1 (LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK).

target.mrk: If a notification callback is needed, you have to set $sText = -1 (LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK).

trans-unit.source: If you use the flag $TTF_IDISHWND then the coordinates in $iLeft, $iTop, $iRight and $iBottom are ignored.

seg-source.mrk: If you use the flag $TTF_IDISHWND then the coordinates in $iLeft, $iTop, $iRight and $iBottom are ignored.

target.mrk: If you use the flag $TTF_IDISHWND then the coordinates in $iLeft, $iTop, $iRight and $iBottom are ignored.

trans-unit.source: If you use the flag $TTF_ABSOLUTE it must be used with the $TTF_TRACK flag.

seg-source.mrk: If you use the flag $TTF_ABSOLUTE it must be used with the $TTF_TRACK flag.

target.mrk: If you use the flag $TTF_ABSOLUTE it must be used with the $TTF_TRACK flag.

trans-unit.source: Normal windows display text left-to-right (LTR). Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL). Normally, tooltip text is displayed in the same direction as the text in its parent window. If $TTF_RTLREADING is set, tooltip text will read in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

seg-source.mrk: Normal windows display text left-to-right (LTR).
Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL).
Normally, tooltip text is displayed in the same direction as the text in its parent window.
If $TTF_RTLREADING is set, tooltip text will read in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

target.mrk: Normal windows display text left-to-right (LTR).
Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL).
Normally, tooltip text is displayed in the same direction as the text in its parent window.
If $TTF_RTLREADING is set, tooltip text will read in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.
